{\it Graphical representation.-- } Up to now we know that a qutrit can be represented by a three-dimensional vector and a metric tensor. A vector is described by three parameters and a tensor is described by five -- three of them correspond to Euler angles defining its principal directions and the remaining two define its eigenvalues (two not three, because of the constraint $\text{Tr}(\mathbf{\hat T})=1$).
